name: tailscale
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Tailscale cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`tailscale` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/tailscale/terraform-provider-tailscale).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Tailscale cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/tailscale/terraform-provider-tailscale)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-tailscale` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-tailscale/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-tailscale` repo](https://github.com/tailscale/terraform-provider-tailscale/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/tailscale/terraform-provider-tailscale)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-tailscale` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-tailscale/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-tailscale` repo](https://github.com/tailscale/terraform-provider-tailscale/issues).

apiKey.description: The API key to use for authenticating requests to the API. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_API_KEY environment variable. Conflicts with 'oauth_client_id' and 'oauth_client_secret'.

baseUrl.description: The base URL of the Tailscale API. Defaults to https://api.tailscale.com. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_BASE_URL environment variable.

identityToken.description: The jwt identity token to exchange for a Tailscale API token when using a federated identity. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_IDENTITY_TOKEN environment variable. Conflicts with 'api_key' and 'oauth_client_secret'.

oauthClientId.description: The OAuth application or federated identity's ID when using OAuth client credentials or workload identity federation. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID environment variable. Either 'oauth_client_secret' or 'identity_token' must be set alongside 'oauth_client_id'. Conflicts with 'api_key'.

oauthClientSecret.description: The OAuth application's secret when using OAuth client credentials. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET environment variable. Conflicts with 'api_key' and 'identity_token'.

scopes.description: The OAuth 2.0 scopes to request when generating the access token using the supplied OAuth client credentials. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1623/trust-credentials#scopes for available scopes. Only valid when both 'oauth_client_id' and 'oauth_client_secret', or both are set.

tailnet.description: The tailnet ID. Tailnets created before Oct 2025 can still use the legacy ID, but the Tailnet ID is the preferred identifier. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_TAILNET environment variable. Default is the tailnet that owns API credentials passed to the provider.

email.description: Email address to send communications to
Email address to send communications to
Email address to send communications to

address.description: The nameserver's IPv4 or IPv6 address

useWithExitNode.description: This nameserver will continue to be used when an exit node is selected (requires Tailscale v1.88.1 or later). Defaults to false.

domain.description: The nameservers will be used only for this domain.

nameservers.description: Set the nameservers used by devices on your network to resolve DNS queries.

address.description: The nameserver's IPv4 or IPv6 address.

useWithExitNode.description: This nameserver will continue to be used when an exit node is selected (requires Tailscale v1.88.1 or later). Defaults to false.

authorized.description: Whether the device is authorized to access the tailnet

blocksIncomingConnections.description: Whether the device blocks incoming connections

clientVersion.description: The Tailscale client version running on the device

created.description: The creation time of the device

expires.description: The expiry time of the device's key

hostname.description: The short hostname of the device

id.description: The legacy identifier of the device. Use node_id instead for new resources.

isExternal.description: Whether the device is marked as external

keyExpiryDisabled.description: Whether the device's key expiry is disabled

lastSeen.description: The last seen time of the device

machineKey.description: The machine key of the device

name.description: The full name of the device (e.g. `hostname.domain.ts.net`)

nodeId.description: The preferred indentifier for a device.

nodeKey.description: The node key of the device

os.description: The operating system of the device

tags.description: The tags applied to the device

tailnetLockError.description: The tailnet lock error for the device, if any

tailnetLockKey.description: The tailnet lock key for the device, if any

updateAvailable.description: Whether an update is available for the device

user.description: The user associated with the device

name.description: The name must be a top-level device property, e.g. isEphemeral, tags, hostname, etc.

values.description: The list of values to filter for. Values are matched as exact matches.

created.description: The time the user joined their tailnet.

currentlyConnected.description: true when the user has a node currently connected to the control server.

deviceCount.description: Number of devices the user owns.

id.description: The unique identifier for the user.

lastSeen.description: The later of either: a) The last time any of the user's nodes were connected to the network or b) The last time the user authenticated to any tailscale service, including the admin panel.

loginName.description: The emailish login name of the user.

profilePicUrl.description: The profile pic URL for the user.

tailnetId.description: The tailnet that owns the user.

type.description: The type of relation this user has to the tailnet associated with the request.

provider.description:
The provider type for the tailscale package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

acl.description: The policy that defines which devices and users are allowed to connect in your network. Can be either a JSON or a HuJSON string.

overwriteExistingContent.description: If true, will skip requirement to import acl before allowing changes. Be careful, can cause the policy file to be overwritten

resetAclOnDestroy.description: If true, will reset the policy file for the Tailnet to the default when this resource is destroyed

acl.description: The policy that defines which devices and users are allowed to connect in your network. Can be either a JSON or a HuJSON string.

overwriteExistingContent.description: If true, will skip requirement to import acl before allowing changes. Be careful, can cause the policy file to be overwritten

resetAclOnDestroy.description: If true, will reset the policy file for the Tailnet to the default when this resource is destroyed

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Acl resources.

acl.description: The policy that defines which devices and users are allowed to connect in your network. Can be either a JSON or a HuJSON string.

overwriteExistingContent.description: If true, will skip requirement to import acl before allowing changes. Be careful, can cause the policy file to be overwritten

resetAclOnDestroy.description: If true, will reset the policy file for the Tailnet to the default when this resource is destroyed

externalId.description: The External ID that Tailscale will supply when assuming your role. You must reference this in your IAM role's trust policy. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id*roles*common-scenarios_third-party.html for more information on external IDs.

tailscaleAwsAccountId.description: The AWS account from which Tailscale will assume your role. You must reference this in your IAM role's trust policy. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id*roles*common-scenarios_third-party.html for more information on external IDs.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AwsExternalId resources.

externalId.description: The External ID that Tailscale will supply when assuming your role. You must reference this in your IAM role's trust policy. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id*roles*common-scenarios_third-party.html for more information on external IDs.

tailscaleAwsAccountId.description: The AWS account from which Tailscale will assume your role. You must reference this in your IAM role's trust policy. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id*roles*common-scenarios_third-party.html for more information on external IDs.

magicDns.description: Whether or not to enable MagicDNS. Defaults to true.

nameservers.description: Set the nameservers used by devices on your network to resolve DNS queries. `override_local_dns` must also be true to prefer these nameservers over local DNS configuration.

overrideLocalDns.description: When enabled, use the configured DNS servers in `nameservers` to resolve names outside the tailnet. When disabled, devices will prefer their local DNS configuration. Defaults to false.

searchPaths.description: Additional search domains. When MagicDNS is on, the tailnet domain is automatically included as the first search domain.

splitDns.description: Set the nameservers used by devices on your network to resolve DNS queries on specific domains (requires Tailscale v1.8 or later). Configuration does not depend on `override_local_dns`.

magicDns.description: Whether or not to enable MagicDNS. Defaults to true.

searchPaths.description: Additional search domains. When MagicDNS is on, the tailnet domain is automatically included as the first search domain.

splitDns.description: Set the nameservers used by devices on your network to resolve DNS queries on specific domains (requires Tailscale v1.8 or later). Configuration does not depend on `override_local_dns`.

audience.description: The value used when matching against the `aud` claim from an OIDC identity token. Specifying the audience is optional as Tailscale will generate a secure audience at creation time by default. It is recommended to let Tailscale generate the audience unless the identity provider you are integrating with requires a specific audience format.

createdAt.description: The creation timestamp of the key in RFC3339 format

customClaimRules.description: A map of claim names to pattern strings used to match against arbitrary claims in the OIDC identity token. Patterns can include `*` characters to match against any character.

description.description: A description of the federated identity consisting of alphanumeric characters. Defaults to `""`.

issuer.description: The issuer of the OIDC identity token used in the token exchange. Must be a valid and publicly reachable https:// URL.

scopes.description: Scopes to grant to the federated identity. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1623/ for a list of available scopes.

subject.description: The pattern used when matching against the `sub` claim from an OIDC identity token. Patterns can include `*` characters to match against any character.

tags.description: A list of tags that access tokens generated for the federated identity will be able to assign to devices. Mandatory if the scopes include "devices:core" or "auth_keys".

updatedAt.description: The updated timestamp of the key in RFC3339 format

userId.description: ID of the user who created this federated identity, empty for federated identities created by other trust credentials.

audience.description: The value used when matching against the `aud` claim from an OIDC identity token. Specifying the audience is optional as Tailscale will generate a secure audience at creation time by default. It is recommended to let Tailscale generate the audience unless the identity provider you are integrating with requires a specific audience format.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering FederatedIdentity resources.

tags.description: A list of tags that access tokens generated for the federated identity will be able to assign to devices. Mandatory if the scopes include "devices:core" or "auth_keys".

userId.description: ID of the user who created this federated identity, empty for federated identities created by other trust credentials.

compressionFormat.description: The compression algorithm used for logs. Valid values are `none`, `zstd` or `gzip`. Defaults to `none`.

destinationType.description: The type of SIEM platform to stream to. Valid values are `axiom`, `cribl`, `datadog`, `elastic`, `gcs`, `panther`, `splunk`, and `s3`.

gcsBucket.description: The name of the GCS bucket

gcsCredentials.description: The encoded string of JSON that is used to authenticate for workload identity in GCS

gcsKeyPrefix.description: The GCS key prefix for the bucket

gcsScopes.description: The GCS scopes needed to be able to write in the bucket

logType.description: The type of logs to stream. Valid values are `configuration` (configuration audit logs) and `network` (network flow logs).

s3AccessKeyId.description: The S3 access key ID. Required if destination*type is s3 and s3*authentication_type is 'accesskey'.

s3AuthenticationType.description: The type of authentication to use for S3. Required if destination_type is `s3`. Valid values are `accesskey` and `rolearn`. Tailscale recommends using `rolearn`.

s3Bucket.description: The S3 bucket name. Required if destination_type is 's3'.

s3ExternalId.description: The AWS External ID that Tailscale supplies when authenticating using role-based authentication. Required if destination*type is 's3' and s3*authentication*type is 'rolearn'. This can be obtained via the tailscale*aws*external*id resource.

s3KeyPrefix.description: An optional S3 key prefix to prepend to the auto-generated S3 key name.

s3Region.description: The region in which the S3 bucket is located. Required if destination_type is 's3'.

s3RoleArn.description: ARN of the AWS IAM role that Tailscale should assume when using role-based authentication. Required if destination*type is 's3' and s3*authentication_type is 'rolearn'.

s3SecretAccessKey.description: The S3 secret access key. Required if destination*type is 's3' and s3*authentication_type is 'accesskey'.

token.description: The token/password with which log streams to this endpoint should be authenticated, required unless destination_type is 's3'.

uploadPeriodMinutes.description: An optional number of minutes to wait in between uploading new logs. If the quantity of logs does not fit within a single upload, multiple uploads will be made.

url.description: The URL to which log streams are being posted. If destination_type is 's3' and you want to use the official Amazon S3 endpoint, leave this empty.

user.description: The username with which log streams to this endpoint are authenticated. Only required if destination_type is 'elastic', defaults to 'user' if not set.

compressionFormat.description: The compression algorithm used for logs. Valid values are `none`, `zstd` or `gzip`. Defaults to `none`.

destinationType.description: The type of SIEM platform to stream to. Valid values are `axiom`, `cribl`, `datadog`, `elastic`, `gcs`, `panther`, `splunk`, and `s3`.

user.description: The username with which log streams to this endpoint are authenticated. Only required if destination_type is 'elastic', defaults to 'user' if not set.

createdAt.description: The creation timestamp of the key in RFC3339 format

description.description: A description of the OAuth client consisting of alphanumeric characters. Defaults to `""`.

key.description: The client secret, also known as the key. Used with the client ID to generate access tokens.

scopes.description: Scopes to grant to the client. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1623/ for a list of available scopes.

tags.description: A list of tags that access tokens generated for the OAuth client will be able to assign to devices. Mandatory if the scopes include "devices:core" or "auth_keys".

updatedAt.description: The updated timestamp of the key in RFC3339 format

userId.description: ID of the user who created this key, empty for OAuth clients created by other trust credentials.

clientSecret.description: The secret (auth key, token, etc.) used to authenticate with the provider.

cloudId.description: Identifies which of the provider's clouds to integrate with.

postureProvider.description: The third-party provider for posture data. Valid values are `falcon`, `intune`, `jamfpro`, `kandji`, `kolide`, and `sentinelone`.

tenantId.description: The Microsoft Intune directory (tenant) ID. For other providers, this is left blank.

createdAt.description: The creation timestamp of the key in RFC3339 format

description.description: A description of the key consisting of alphanumeric characters. Defaults to `""`.

ephemeral.description: Indicates if the key is ephemeral. Defaults to `false`.

expiresAt.description: The expiry timestamp of the key in RFC3339 format

expiry.description: The expiry of the key in seconds. Defaults to `7776000` (90 days).

invalid.description: Indicates whether the key is invalid (e.g. expired, revoked or has been deleted).

preauthorized.description: Determines whether or not the machines authenticated by the key will be authorized for the tailnet by default. Defaults to `false`.

recreateIfInvalid.description: Determines whether the key should be created again if it becomes invalid. By default, reusable keys will be recreated, but single-use keys will not. Possible values: 'always', 'never'.

reusable.description: Indicates if the key is reusable or single-use. Defaults to `false`.

tags.description: List of tags to apply to the machines authenticated by the key.

userId.description: ID of the user who created this key, empty for keys created by OAuth clients.

endpointUrl.description: The endpoint to send webhook events to.

providerType.description: The provider type of the endpoint URL. This determines the payload format sent to the destination. Valid values are `slack`, `mattermost`, `googlechat`, and `discord`.

secret.description: The secret used for signing webhook payloads. Only set on resource creation. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1213/webhooks#webhook-secret for more information.

subscriptions.description: The set of events that trigger this webhook. For a full list of event types, see the [webhooks documentation](https://tailscale.com/kb/1213/webhooks#events).

pulumi:providers:tailscale/terraformConf.description: This function returns a Terraform config object with terraform-namecased keys,to be used with the Terraform Module Provider.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking get4Via6.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by get4Via6.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

tailscale:index/getAcl:getAcl.description:
The acl data source gets the Tailscale policy file for a tailnet

> **Note:** The naming of this data source predates Tailscale's usage of the term "policy file" to refer to the centralized configuration file for a tailnet. This data source fetches a tailnet's entire policy file and not just the ACLs section within it.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getAcl.

hujson.description: The contents of Tailscale ACL as a HuJSON string

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

json.description: The contents of Tailscale ACL as a JSON string

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getDevice.

hostname.description: The short hostname of the device

name.description: The full name of the device (e.g. `hostname.domain.ts.net`)

waitFor.description: If specified, the provider will make multiple attempts to obtain the data source until the wait_for duration is reached. Retries are made every second so this value should be greater than 1s

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDevice.

authorized.description: Whether the device is authorized to access the tailnet

blocksIncomingConnections.description: Whether the device blocks incoming connections

clientVersion.description: The Tailscale client version running on the device

created.description: The creation time of the device

expires.description: The expiry time of the device's key

hostname.description: The short hostname of the device

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

isExternal.description: Whether the device is marked as external

keyExpiryDisabled.description: Whether the device's key expiry is disabled

lastSeen.description: The last seen time of the device

machineKey.description: The machine key of the device

name.description: The full name of the device (e.g. `hostname.domain.ts.net`)

nodeId.description: The preferred indentifier for a device.

nodeKey.description: The node key of the device

os.description: The operating system of the device

tags.description: The tags applied to the device

tailnetLockError.description: The tailnet lock error for the device, if any

tailnetLockKey.description: The tailnet lock key for the device, if any

updateAvailable.description: Whether an update is available for the device

user.description: The user associated with the device

waitFor.description: If specified, the provider will make multiple attempts to obtain the data source until the wait_for duration is reached. Retries are made every second so this value should be greater than 1s

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getDevices.

filters.description: Filters the device list to elements devices whose fields match the provided values.

namePrefix.description: Filters the device list to elements whose name has the provided prefix

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getDevices.

devices.description: The list of devices in the tailnet

filters.description: Filters the device list to elements devices whose fields match the provided values.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

namePrefix.description: Filters the device list to elements whose name has the provided prefix

tailscale:index/getUser:getUser.description: The user data source describes a single user in a tailnet

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getUser.

id.description: The unique identifier for the user.

loginName.description: The emailish login name of the user.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getUser.

created.description: The time the user joined their tailnet.

currentlyConnected.description: true when the user has a node currently connected to the control server.

deviceCount.description: Number of devices the user owns.

id.description: The unique identifier for the user.

lastSeen.description: The later of either: a) The last time any of the user's nodes were connected to the network or b) The last time the user authenticated to any tailscale service, including the admin panel.

loginName.description: The emailish login name of the user.

profilePicUrl.description: The profile pic URL for the user.

tailnetId.description: The tailnet that owns the user.

type.description: The type of relation this user has to the tailnet associated with the request.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getUsers.

role.description: Filter the results to only include users with a specific role. Valid values are `owner`, `member`, `admin`, `it-admin`, `network-admin`, `billing-admin`, and `auditor`.

type.description: Filter the results to only include users of a specific type. Valid values are `member` or `shared`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getUsers.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

role.description: Filter the results to only include users with a specific role. Valid values are `owner`, `member`, `admin`, `it-admin`, `network-admin`, `billing-admin`, and `auditor`.

type.description: Filter the results to only include users of a specific type. Valid values are `member` or `shared`.

users.description: The list of users in the tailnet
